title: First cabinet of curiosities created!
description: Let's go and pick up stones for our cabinet of curiosities.

title: Greek colonisation!
description: These immigrants come to bring us civilization and their panoply of women representing the Arts.

title: SPQRverywhere
description: Roman art all over the known world!

title: Opening of the mouth ceremony!
description: As long as it is wine (in a Nagada vase).

title: The adolescence of art!
description: Gothic mood and other questionable medieval tastes.

title: Kaleidoscopislamic art!
description: The moment in art history when it went too far in terms of new glazing techniques...

title: Renaissance of what?
description: The european artdolescence discovered LSD, and the Gothic became too colorful, too misshapen, too bizarre.

title: Modern Times!
description: The quarantine crisis in Europe: what if we were going to steal art from our barbarian neighbors?

title: Asia discovered!
description: Almost civilized/Europe: perhaps they discovered art?

title: Sub-Saharan Africa discovered!
description: Rather civilized/Europe: their art is still ugly. But let's wait for the cubists before taking a new look.

title: Northern- and Southern-America discovered!
description: Not too civilized/Europe: In the north, there is nothing. In the south, we can find two or three valid things.

title: Oceania discovered!
description: Not at all civilized/Europe: it will be complicated about artworks...

title: Prehistoric times discovered!
description: In search of the first artwork of Humanity for our museum!

title: Mesopotamia discovered!
description: The Mesopotamians may not have invented art, but at least they respected the proportions...

title: Modern art discovered!
description: The beginning of boredom, the beginning of the mess.

title: Contemporary art discovered!
description: We don't really know what to do anymore, so let's do anything.

title: Post-* studies discovered!
description: Now that we've done everything, it's time to see how we can undo everything.

title: New shelf for your cabinet of curiosities (level 5)
description: Your cabinet of curiosities becomes a little more specialized with naturalia.

title: New shelf for your cabinet of curiosities (level 25)
description: Your cabinet of curiosities becomes a little more specialized with artificialia.

title: New shelf for your cabinet of curiosities (level 50)
description: Your cabinet of curiosities becomes a little more specialized with scientifica.

title: New shelf for your cabinet of curiosities (level 100)
description: Your cabinet of curiosities becomes a little more specialized with exotica.

description: Your new studies department becomes a little more specialized with repatriation issues.

title: The first connoisseur hired!
description: He's your little cousin. Your aunt asked you to take him out of his room.

title: The first Master student hired!
description: Another one who has the hope that you will intercede with his teachers so that he can graduate.

title: The first PhD student hired!
description: Cool, your Master Students are developing Stockholm syndrome...

title: The first postdoc hired!
description: All your research are belong to us

title: The first research fellow hired!
description: All your art theory are belong to us

title: The first art historian hired!
description: All your library are belong to us!

title: The first permanent staff hired!
description: All your coffee maker are belong to us

title: The first ICOM member hired!
description: The art world is almost yours!

title: 5 Master Students working for you!
description: My first permanent team, made up of interchangeable and unpaid people.

title: 25 Master Students working for you!
description: Fordism in the art world.

title: 100 Master Students working for you!
description: The whole art history university is working at the museum.

title: 5 Permanent Staff working for you!
description: The Secretariat Department is fully functional.

title: 25 Permanent Staff working for you!
description: The Technical Team Department has been created and is fully functional.

title: 50 Permanent Staff working for you!
description: Each conservation department has been created and is fully functional.

title: 100 Permanent Staff working for you!
description: It is no longer a museum, but a veritable anthill.

title: 5 ICOM students members working for you!
description: It's museumslavery with extra steps.

title: 25 ICOFOM members working for you!
description: What is museology? Let's have a meeting to invent it.

title: You created an ICOM committee for your museum!
description: 50 ICOM members have seceded to create an ICOM committee on behalf of your museum.

title: All members of ICOM working for you!
description: Your museum is ICOM. The simpler, the better.

title: Your first artwork!
description: "We have to start with something!", dixit Dominique Vivant Denon one day.

title: 100 artworks in your museum!
description: You opened your first department with a few hundred works of art. Congratulations!

title: 1k artworks in your museum!
description: Your museum is getting serious. What if you hire a curator from the Louvre?

title: 10k artworks in your museum!
description: Your museum has more linear meters of walls than the Louvre, the MET and the Center Pompidou combined.

title: 100k artworks in your museum!
description: The other museums in the world take the name of your museum and affix the name of their city to it.

title: 100 artworks acquired by your museum!
description: You bought the closet from the neighbor and found things that could be studied and exhibited.

title: 10k artworks acquired by your museum!
description: Napoleon has just returned from his extended weekend in Italy. He brought you some knick-knacks.

title: 100M artworks acquired by your museum!
description: The serious things begin: we have to buy nails, hammers and display cases.

title: 100M artworks acquired by your museum!
description: Too many artworks, too much artworks!

title: 10G artworks acquired by your museum!
description: You have started collecting artifacts beyond Earth.

title: Ticket office
description: You have 100 MuseuMoney in your ticket office.

title: 10k in the Tutankhamun's mummy
description: The cash desk drawers are full. You are now storing tickets in a sarcophagus in the department of Egyptian Antiquities.

title: Creation of the endowment fund
description: With all those 1M MuseuMoney, it was time to create an endowment fund for your museum.

title: Your museum tickets are the new Bitcoin.
description: Despite your museum is a non-profit institution, you have taxed 100M MuseuMoney from our visitors. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

title: The art market is collapsing.
description: With 10G MuseuMoney in your piggy bank, the art market has no interest in existing and collapses, taking with it all of the financial markets.

title: 100 loans around the world!
description: Your grandmother is proud of your first exhibition, which has just ended in the attic of her house.

title: 10k loans around the world!
description: Your temporary exhibitions are starting to travel around the world.

title: 1M loans around the world!
description: Your museum has become a factory for temporary international exhibitions.

title: 100M loans around the world!
description: Wasn't it easier to buy other museums in the world rather than lend them your works?

title: 10G loans around the world!
description: The whole world is your museum. No more loan problems!

title: 100 MuseuMoney spent!
description: You had the first visit guides printed with the benefits of the ticket office.

title: 10k MuseuMoney spent!
description: Do not forget to thank the generous sponsor for the check which allows you to buy new artworks and which will allow him to benefit from a nice tax reduction.

title: 1M MuseuMoney spent!
description: Enlarge Your Museum: it's time to have an extension, or two, of your museum built by Renzo Piano and Jean Nouvel.

title: 100M MuseuMoney spent!
description: The new definition of the museum, voted by the ICOM general assembly, contains only a few words: the name of your museum. MuseuMoney can buy anything!

title: 10G MuseuMoney spent!
description: You have just bought ICOM. It was time to tidy up this cenacle of utopian hippies. MuseuMoney can buy everything!
